programme.title: Destruction Decoded
programme.desc: Is it possible to protect ourselves from the catastrophic destructive power of earthquakes?

programme.title: Destruction Decoded
programme.desc: Enter a volcanic crater and go under the Earth to discover what makes erupting volcanoes so deadly.

programme.title: Destruction Decoded
programme.desc: How do tornadoes form, why are they so unpredictable, and what can scientists do to minimize their damage?

programme.title: Destruction Decoded
programme.desc: Transportation accidents can endanger thousands in seconds. Can anything be done to minimize their damage?

programme.title: Moon Shots
programme.desc: With rare archive footage, this stunning one-hour special brings scientific history to life.

programme.title: Apollo's New Moon
programme.desc: This film shows how collected evidence revolutionized our understanding of the origin of the solar system.

programme.title: Cosmic Journeys
programme.desc: What are scientists learning about the history of the Moon and its relationship to the development of Earth?

programme.title: Cosmic Journeys
programme.desc: There are plans to send spacecraft to the Moon to find resources that may one day allow humans to live there.

programme.title: Secrets of the Universe
programme.desc: Follow the era of space exploration, from Sputnik through lunar landings to today's private space flights.

programme.title: Battle For the Moon
programme.desc: After a string of successful space flights by the USSR, The United States responded by forming NASA.

programme.desc: After the Gemini program, America embarked on the Apollo program.

programme.desc: Apollo 13 suffers an oxygen leak that leaves the spacecraft with limited power.
